item.title: Google Chrome Extensions Under Attack: Hackers Are Spreading Code To Steal Sensitive Information, Here's All We Know - ABP Live
item.description:
Google Chrome Extensions Under Attack: Hackers Are Spreading Code To Steal Sensitive Information, Here's All We Know

Publication Date: Not specified Source: Reuters

A cyberattack campaign has been identified, targeting 16 Chrome extensions aimed at stealing sensitive data from Facebook advertisers. Cybersecurity firm Cyberhaven reports that affected extensions were designed to extract user IDs, access tokens, cookies, and other important credentials.

Key Points

  • Cyberattack targets 16 Chrome extensions used by Facebook ad users.
  • The malicious code extracted critical information, impacting multiple organizations.
  • Cyberhaven confirmed a hack occurred on December 24, affecting its Chrome extension version 24.10.4.
  • Other extensions, including ParrotTalks, Uvoice, and VPNCity, were also compromised.
  • The harmful code was active for less than a day and affected users with auto-updates enabled.
“The incident was brief and contained.” – Cyberhaven

This breach underscores the rising risk of compromised browser extensions and the urgent need for enhanced user security measures.

item.title: Top 5 AR Gadgets to Look Forward to in 2025 - Analytics Insight
item.description:
Top 5 AR Gadgets to Look Forward to in 2025

Publication Date: May 6, 2024 | Source: Analytics Insight

This article discusses the top five augmented reality (AR) gadgets set to debut in 2025, highlighting their innovative features and the impact they may have on various sectors.

  • Apple Glass

    : Debuts with seamless AR integration, enhancing productivity and entertainment in Apple’s ecosystem.

  • Microsoft HoloLens 3

    : Revolutionizes industries with doubled field of view and varifocal depth focusing.

  • Viture Pro XR

    : Impresses with a 135-inch virtual display, myopia adjustment, and 120Hz refresh rate.

  • Snap Spectacles 5

    : Redefines AR creation with gesture control and integrated AI for developers and creators.

  • XReal Air 2 Ultra

    : Offers spatial computing with a lightweight design, hand tracking, and device versatility.
These innovative gadgets are set to change the way we interact with digital content and enhance various aspects of daily life.

In conclusion, the future of augmented reality looks promising with these upcoming gadgets, which are anticipated to drive innovation and user engagement in AR technology.

item.title: Xiaomi 15 Ultra Might Be Launched In March During MWC 2025, Here's What We Know - ABP Live
item.description:
Xiaomi 15 Ultra Might Be Launched In March During MWC 2025, Here's What We Know

Published on: 30 Dec 2024 10:16 PM (IST)

The Xiaomi 15 Ultra is expected to launch during the Mobile World Congress (MWC) 2025. Rumored features include a Snapdragon 8 Elite chipset and a 200-megapixel periscope camera.

Key Points:

  • The Xiaomi 15 Ultra is anticipated to launch as part of the Xiaomi 15 series.
  • It features a Snapdragon 8 Elite chipset and a 200-megapixel telephoto camera.
  • IP68 and IP69 durability ratings are expected.
  • The launch is rumored for March 2, 2025, during MWC.
  • Global release expected alongside the already launched Xiaomi 15 in China.
“March 2nd” — Yogesh Brar (@heyitsyogesh)

The Xiaomi 15 Ultra is generating significant anticipation in the tech community, especially with its powerful specifications and potential launch timeline.

item.title: WhatsApp Web to get 'Reverse Image Search' feature to curb misinformation - CNBCTV18
item.description:
WhatsApp Web Introduces 'Reverse Image Search'

Publication Date: March 2024 | Source: CNBC TV18

WhatsApp Web is set to roll out a new reverse image search feature designed to help users verify the authenticity of photos and combat the spread of misinformation.

  • The new feature allows users to upload photos for verification through Google.
  • This tool aims to identify manipulated or out-of-context images.
  • Access is through the overflow menu in the image viewing interface.
  • WhatsApp reassures that it will not access the content of the uploaded images.
  • The aim is to empower users to make informed decisions regarding the content they share and receive.
“By integrating this feature, WhatsApp aims to empower users to make informed decisions about the content they share and receive, especially in cases where misinformation or manipulated media might be a concern.”

This new feature marks a significant step towards equipping users with tools to verify shared content and protect themselves from misinformation.

item.title: Apple could bring its ‘Pro’ OLED displays to the entire iPhone 17 line - The Verge
item.description:
Apple could bring its ‘Pro’ OLED displays to the entire iPhone 17 line

Date: December 30, 2024 Source: MacRumors

According to a leak from Digital Chat Station, Apple may equip its entire iPhone 17 lineup with high-refresh-rate OLED displays, a feature currently exclusive to the ‘Pro’ models.

  • The base iPhone 17 is rumored to feature a high refresh rate display as per leaks.
  • Previous accurate leaks from Digital Chat Station regarding iPhone components boost confidence in the rumor.
  • Apple is expected to use the same LTPO panel technology used in the iPhone 16 Pro across all models.
  • Future models may include an iPhone 17 “Slim” replacing the current base model.
  • The entire lineup is anticipated to feature 24MP front-facing cameras and a new Apple-designed Wi-Fi/Bluetooth chip.
“Instead of differentiating by display tech, Apple could stratify the lineup in different ways.”

This potential shift may mark a significant transformation in how Apple markets its iPhone lineup, making advanced display technology more accessible to all users.

item.title: WhatsApp Integrates Google Reverse Image Search to Combat Misinformation - Mobile ID World
item.description:
WhatsApp Integrates Google Reverse Image Search to Combat Misinformation

Publication Date: Not specified Source: Various sources

WhatsApp has added a new reverse image search capability to its messaging platform, enhancing its security tools. Users can now verify the authenticity of images directly within WhatsApp, using Google's image search technology.

  • Users tap an image and select “Search on the web” to verify authenticity.
  • The feature preserves user privacy by not storing uploaded images on WhatsApp servers.
  • This capability is currently in testing and aims to counter misinformation by identifying original sources of images.
  • It enhances existing security features and will be available for all users soon.
“The reverse image search capability enhances existing WhatsApp security features, providing users with integrated tools to assess the authenticity of received media.”

This new feature is a significant step towards combating misinformation and helping users make informed decisions about content sharing.

item.title: POCO X7 and POCO X7 Pro launching in India on January 9 - FoneArena
item.description:
POCO X7 and POCO X7 Pro Launching in India on January 9

Date: January 9, 2024 Source: FoneArena

POCO has confirmed the launch of its new X7 and X7 Pro 5G smartphones in India and global markets on January 9, following numerous rumors and leaks.

  • 6.67-inch 1.5K OLED display with 120Hz refresh rate and HDR10+
  • Up to 2.5GHz MediaTek Dimensity 7300 Ultra processor for POCO X7
  • Up to 3.25GHz MediaTek Dimensity 8400 Ultra processor for POCO X7 Pro
  • 50MP main camera with OIS in both models
  • X7 Pro features up to 6000mAh battery with 90W fast charging
“The POCO X7 Pro will also be introduced as Redmi Turbo 4 in the Chinese market on January 2.”

POCO is set to deliver impressive specifications and designs in its upcoming launches, marking its continued growth in the smartphone market.

item.title: Japanese luxury footwear brand Onitsuka Tiger eyes manufacturing in India - NewsBytes
item.description:
Japanese luxury footwear brand Onitsuka Tiger eyes manufacturing in India

Publication Date: Not specified Source: NewsBytes

Onitsuka Tiger, a subsidiary of Asics Corporation, is considering establishing a manufacturing base in India to capitalize on the growing premium footwear market in the region.

  • The company has seen double-digit growth in India over the past year.
  • Currently operates 11 stores in India and plans to open two more next year.
  • India's footwear market is estimated to grow at a CAGR of 4.8% between 2023 and 2028.
  • Onitsuka Tiger recorded net sales of 60.3 billion yen (approximately $382 million) in 2023.
“India is a crucial market for Onitsuka Tiger considering its huge consumer base and rising demand for premium goods.” - Ryoji Shoda, Vice-President

This move is seen as a strategic effort to enhance the brand's growth and value proposition in light of increasing demand for luxury products in India.

item.title: Spotify’s search results are exposing users to adult content, what the company has to say - The Times of India
item.description:
Spotify’s Search Results Exposing Users to Adult Content: Company Response

Publication Date: October 2023

Source: Unknown

Spotify is facing criticism as its search results inadvertently expose users to adult content. The company has issued a statement addressing the concerns raised by users about this issue.

  • Users have reported that searching for certain songs or artists returned results that included explicit content.
  • Spotify's content filtering mechanisms are being scrutinized as the company works to enhance user safety.
  • The company reassured users that it is actively investigating the situation.
“We take these matters seriously and are committed to ensuring a safe listening experience for all our users.” - Spotify Representative

In conclusion, Spotify acknowledges the issue and is working towards a solution to improve its content filtering to prevent adult content exposure in search results.

item.title: Spotify under fire: Pornographic content found in search results for artist M.I.A - Mint
item.description:
Spotify under fire: Pornographic content found in search results for artist M.I.A

Publication Date: December 29, 2024 | Source: The Verge

Spotify, the popular music streaming platform, has recently faced significant backlash after users reported encountering pornographic videos in search results related to artist M.I.A. This issue first gained attention on a Reddit thread, where users expressed their frustrations about explicit content appearing on the platform.

This incident raised concerns about Spotify's moderation practices, especially regarding content uploaded through its podcast feature, which currently lacks pre-upload moderation.

  • Explicit videos appeared in search results for artist M.I.A.
  • The issue was highlighted in a Reddit thread, with many users confirming similar experiences.
  • Spotify's podcast feature allows explicit content to bypass moderation due to a loophole.
  • Despite claims that flagged content has been removed, users feel their complaints are inadequately addressed.
  • This situation has spurred discussions among users advocating for better content moderation tools.
“It feels like they just don’t really care.” - Spotify user

In conclusion, Spotify's recent incident underscores the necessity for improved content moderation and responsiveness to user concerns regarding inappropriate material.

item.title: Redmi 14C 5G Colourways, Display Details Teased Ahead of January 6 Launch - Gadgets 360
item.description:
Redmi 14C 5G Colourways, Display Details Teased Ahead of Launch

Publication Date: December 2024 | Source: Gadgets 360

The Redmi 14C 5G is set to launch in India in January, with teasers revealing its color options and display specifications, including a 6.88-inch HD+ display.

  • Available in three colors: Starlight Blue, Stardust Purple, and Stargaze Black.
  • Features a 6.88-inch HD+ display with a 120Hz refresh rate.
  • Equipped with a 50-megapixel AI-backed main camera.
  • Will be available for purchase through Amazon.
“The launch of Redmi 14C 5G will take place on January 6.”

This upcoming smartphone highlights Xiaomi's commitment to providing new technology at competitive prices, positioning itself in the mid-range market with innovative features.

item.title: OnePlus 13 coming to India soon, it brings Project Starlight, lifetime display warranty & AI features with it - India Today
item.description:
OnePlus 13 coming to India soon, it brings Project Starlight, lifetime display warranty & AI features with it

Published On: Dec 30, 2024 By: Ankita Garg

The OnePlus 13 series, including the OnePlus 13 and OnePlus 13R, will launch in India on January 7, featuring OxygenOS 15 with AI capabilities and a lifetime display warranty.

Key Points:

  • Launch date: January 7, 2025.
  • Incorporates OxygenOS 15 focused on AI for enhanced productivity.
  • Lifetime display warranty covering defects for the device's lifespan.
  • Project Starlight aims to address India-specific issues with advanced display technology.
  • Expected to feature Qualcomm Snapdragon 8 Elite chipset and improved hardware.
OnePlus is going to offer a lifetime display warranty on all its smartphone models.

Overall, the OnePlus 13 series is set to attract attention with its combination of AI features and robust warranty offerings.

item.title: OnePlus 13 coming to India soon, it brings Project Starlight, lifetime display warranty and AI smarts with it - India Today
item.description:
OnePlus 13 Series Launching Soon in India with AI Smarts, Lifetime Display Warranty, and More

Date & Source: Published on Dec 30, 2024 by Ankita Garg

Get ready for the upcoming OnePlus 13 series, including the OnePlus 13 and the OnePlus 13R, set to launch in India on January 7, 2025. These flagships bring a host of exciting features like OxygenOS 15 AI features, a lifetime display warranty, and top-quality hardware.

  • OxygenOS 15 with AI smarts, including Intelligent Search, AI Detail Boost, AI Unblur, and AI Reflection Eraser
  • Lifetime display warranty, covering industry-wide issues like the green line display problem
  • Project Starlight features, including the world's first DisplayMate A++ display on a flagship phone
  • Flagship hardware, including the Qualcomm Snapdragon 8 Elite chipset, 12-16GB RAM, and a versatile camera system tuned in collaboration with Hasselblad
OnePlus is offering a lifetime display warranty on the OnePlus 13 series, setting it apart from competitors.

The Indian version of the OnePlus 13R is expected to come with an improved camera setup compared to its Chinese counterpart. Stay tuned for more details on January 7, 2025.

item.title: Onitsuka Tiger considering India as manufacturing hub for regional growth | Company Business News - Mint
item.description:
Onitsuka Tiger Considering India as Manufacturing Hub for Regional Growth

Publication Date: N/A Source: Mint

Japanese footwear brand Onitsuka Tiger, part of Asics Corporation, is contemplating India as a potential manufacturing hub to hasten its growth in the region.

“Establishing a manufacturing base in India is a strategic move that can significantly accelerate Onitsuka Tiger’s growth in the region. India’s market potential for premium footwear and apparel is growing rapidly, and setting up local manufacturing will add value,” Ryoji Shoda, vice-president of Onitsuka Tiger.
  • Onitsuka Tiger aims to enhance regional growth through local manufacturing in India.
  • The vice-president noted the rapid growth of India's premium footwear and apparel market.
  • A strategic manufacturing base in India could add significant value to the brand.

The potential establishment of a manufacturing hub in India reflects Onitsuka Tiger's commitment to tapping into one of the fastest-growing markets for premium goods in Asia.
